metadata.title: CVE-2023-52480 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ksmbd:fix race condition between session lookup and expire Thread A + Thread Bksmbd_session_lookup | smb2_sess_setup sess = xa_load | | |xa_erase(&conn->sessions, sess->id); | | ksmbd_session_destroy(sess) -->kfree(sess) | // UAF! | sess->last_active = jiffies | + This patch addrwsem to fix race condition between ksmbd_session_lookup andksmbd_expire_session.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52480` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2082-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2082.88
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2082-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2082.88
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2066-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2066.71
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
